question:
Which of the following was one of the major ports during the Indo-Greek trade?
1) Broach
2) Sopara 
3) Tamralipti 
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: Trade started across the sea between India and The Easter Roman Empires. Among the ports, the important ones were Broach, Sopara, Arikamedu, and Tamralipti. Out of these ports, Broach was the most important as not only goods were exported from here but goods were also received.
